labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on providing comprehensive weather-related data through various APIs. It offers real-time weather conditions, forecasts (hourly, daily, minutely), air quality data, life indices, and weather warnings. The server acts as an integration tool for QWeather services, enabling seamless access to weather information for AI assistants and applications via standardized interfaces (stdio or SSE transports). The tools provided cover a wide range of weather and environmental data needs, making it highly useful for applications requiring precise weather information.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Weather" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around providing weather-related data, which aligns perfectly with the predefined "Weather" category. Secondary labels "API Integration" and "Data Analysis & Processing" are selected because the server primarily functions as an API gateway for weather data and can be used for processing and analyzing weather information. Custom labels are unnecessary as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: QWeather API Integration Server
server_info_crawled.author: @overstarry/qweather-mcp-go
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time weather, forecast, air quality, and life indices data through a standardized MCP interface. Enable seamless integration of QWeather services into AI assistants and applications via stdio or SSE transports. Easily configure and run the server to access comprehensive weather information programmatically.

tools.name: get-air-quality
tools.description: Deploy Server QWeather API Integration Server @overstarry/qweather-mcp-go Try in Playground get-air-quality

tools.name: get-air-quality-daily
tools.description: Daily air quality forecast API provides air quality predictions for the next 3 days, including AQI values, pollutant concentrations, and health recommendations. Data includes various air quality standards and specific concentrations of pollutants such as PM2.5, PM10, NO2, O3, SO2, etc.

tools.name: get-air-quality-hourly
tools.description: Hourly air quality forecast API provides air quality data for the next 24 hours, including AQI, pollutant concentrations, sub-indices, and health recommendations. Data includes various air quality standards (such as QAQI, GB-DEFRA, etc.) and specific concentrations of pollutants like PM2.5, PM10, NO2, O3, SO2, etc.

tools.name: get-hourly-forecast
tools.description: Hourly weather forecast API provides detailed weather information for the next 24-168 hours for cities worldwide. Available data includes: temperature, weather conditions, wind force, wind speed, wind direction, relative humidity, atmospheric pressure, precipitation probability, dew point temperature, and cloud cover. Forecast data is updated hourly to ensure accuracy.

tools.name: get-minutely-precipitation
tools.description: Minutely precipitation forecast API provides accurate precipitation predictions for the next 2 hours for cities worldwide. Available data includes precipitation type (rain/snow) and amount for each minute. This high-precision forecast is particularly useful for outdoor activity planning and real-time weather monitoring.

tools.name: get-weather-forecast
tools.description: Weather forecast API provides detailed weather predictions for cities worldwide, supporting forecasts from 3 to 30 days. Available data includes: sunrise/sunset times, moonrise/moonset times, temperature range, weather conditions, wind direction and speed, relative humidity, precipitation, atmospheric pressure, cloud cover, and UV index. Forecasts are updated daily to ensure accuracy.

tools.name: get-weather-indices
tools.description: Weather life indices forecast API provides various life indices for cities worldwide. Supports 1-day and 3-day forecasts. Available index types: - Type 0: All index types - Type 1: Sports (indicates suitability for outdoor sports activities) - Type 2: Car Washing (suggests whether it's suitable to wash cars) - Type 3: Dressing (provides clothing suggestions based on weather) - Type 4: Fishing (shows suitability of fishing conditions) - Type 5: UV (ultraviolet radiation intensity level) - Type 6: Travel (indicates suitability for travel and sightseeing) - Type 7: Allergy (allergy and pollen risk level) - Type 8: Cold (cold risk level) - Type 9: Comfort (overall comfort level of weather) - Type 10: Wind (wind conditions and their effects) - Type 11: Sunglasses (need for wearing sunglasses) - Type 12: Makeup (weather effects on makeup) - Type 13: Sunscreen (sunscreen needs) - Type 14: Traffic (weather effects on traffic conditions) - Type 15: Sports Watching (suitability for watching outdoor sports) - Type 16: Air Pollution Diffusion Conditions (air pollution diffusion conditions) Note: Not all cities provide all indices. International cities mainly support types 1, 2, 4, and 5.

tools.name: get-weather-now
tools.description: Real-time weather API provides current weather conditions for cities worldwide. Available data includes: temperature, feels-like temperature, weather conditions, wind direction, wind force level, relative humidity, precipitation, atmospheric pressure, and visibility. Data is updated in real-time, providing the most accurate current weather information.

tools.name: get-weather-warning
tools.description: Weather warning API provides real-time weather warning data issued by official agencies in China and multiple countries/regions worldwide. Data includes warning issuing agency, publication time, warning title, detailed warning information, warning level, warning type, and other relevant information.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@overstarry/qweather-mcp-go/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
